title: ğŸš€ Google Launches Nano Banana 2 â€” New Default Image Generation Model in Gemini, Search & AI Studio

sources.author: TechCrunch
sources.text: Google launches Nano Banana 2 model with faster image generation. Google is making Nano Banana 2 a default model in Gemini app and in AI mode.

sources.text: Google reveals Nano Banana 2 AI image model, coming to Gemini today. Google's new image model replaces the previous versions immediately.

sources.author: Wired
sources.text: Hands-On With Nano Banana 2, the Latest Version of Googleâ€™s AI Image Generator. Googleâ€™s latest image model, Nano Banana 2, is a powerful AI photo editor that punctures reality. Well, sometimes.

sources.text: Nano Banana 2 Is Here: What Changed in Google's Popular AI Image Tool. Google says the second-generation model uses the precision of the pro model with the speed of the original.

sources.author: sundarpichai
sources.text:
Introducing Nano Banana 2, our best image model yet ğŸŒğŸŒ

It uses Geminiâ€™s understanding of the world and is powered by real-time information and images from web search. That means it can better reflect

key_facts: Nano Banana 2 is Google's next-generation AI image model, replacing prior versions immediately as the default in Gemini app, AI mode, Search (141 countries), Flow, and Antigravity

It integrates Geminiâ€™s world understanding with real-time web search data (e.g., live local weather) to generate high-fidelity, context-aware imagesâ€”demonstrated in the 'Window Seat' demo with 2K/4K output
Available today in preview via Google AI Studio and Vertex AI
analyst_angle: This signals Googleâ€™s strategic shift toward contextually grounded, real-time-augmented multimodal generationâ€”blurring the line between static image models and dynamic, information-integrated AI agents.

key_facts: OpenClaw released versions 2026.2.25 and 2026.2.26 with major agent runtime upgrades
Introduced ACP (Agent Control Plane) thread-bound agents as first-class runtime primitives
Launched Codex â€” a WebSocket-first transport layer enabling real-time, context-coherent agent interactions
Added auto-memory support (aligned with Claude Codeâ€™s new capability), enabling persistent, adaptive agent state across sessions
analyst_angle: This release signals a shift from stateless chatbot wrappers to production-grade, lifecycle-managed autonomous agents â€” positioning OpenClaw as a serious infrastructure layer for agentic AI orchestration, not just an interface.

analyst_angle: This is not a traditional acquisition but a strategic, pre-commercial offtake agreement at unprecedented scaleâ€”signaling massive corporate demand for grid-scale, multi-day energy storage and validating iron-air chemistry as a viable alternative to lithium-ion for decarbonizing data infrastructure.

Multiple official accounts (Cursor AI, Runway ML) shared dedicated landing links, confirming this is a formal dual-product launchâ€”not just research or teaser.
analyst_angle: This signals a maturing of vertical AI tooling: coding and video generationâ€”two high-impact creative/developer workflowsâ€”are now shipping production-grade, tightly integrated agents, accelerating the shift from chat-based assistants to autonomous workflow co-pilots.

title: ğŸ¤ Google and Meta Strike Multibillion-Dollar AI Chip Deal Amid Meta's Cancellation of Advanced In-House Chip

sources.author: theinformation
sources.text:

Read more from @Amir and @AnissaGardizy8 ğŸ‘‡ 
https://t.co/fvBeRH1LX0

sources.author: theinformation
sources.text:

Read more from @jyoti_mann1, @WayneMa and @QianerLiu ğŸ‘‡ 
https://t

sources.author: theinformation
sources.text: Meta Platforms scrapped its most advanced in-house AI training chip after design struggles, underscoring how hard it is to rival Nvidia. https://t.co/Qe233K7wQ2

sources.author: theinformation
sources.text:
Meta Platforms has signed a deal to rent Googleâ€™s AI chips, known as TPUs, to develop new AI models.

The deal is a victory for Google, posing a threat to Nvidia, which dominates the AI chip market an

key_facts: Google and Meta signed a multibillion-dollar deal for Meta to rent Google's TPUs for AI model development.
Meta scrapped its most advanced in-house AI training chip due to design struggles.
The partnership marks a strategic shift by Meta away from custom silicon toward cloud-based AI acceleration, directly challenging Nvidia's dominance.
This deal strengthens Google's position as an AI infrastructure provider and intensifies the rivalry between Google and Nvidia in the AI chip market.
analyst_angle: Metaâ€™s retreat from cutting-edge custom AI chip developmentâ€”and pivot to outsourcing compute to Googleâ€”signals that even hyperscalers with massive R&D budgets are hitting diminishing returns on bespoke silicon, accelerating consolidation around dominant AI hardware/cloud platforms.

1ï¸âƒ£ Hack to Create: Build the eng

sources.author: LambdaAPI
sources.text:
Lambda is at NVIDIA GTC 2026 in San Jose, March 16-19.

On Wednesday night (March 18), we're hostingÂ AI After Dark: no panels or pitches. Just engineers, researchers, and operators in the same room wi

key_facts: NVIDIA is hosting two major on-site hackathons at GTC 2026 (March 16â€“19, San Jose): 'Hack to Create' (creator economy tools) and 'Hack for Impact' (using Nemotron & Cosmos for human/ecological/cultural applications)
Participants build on GB10 systems from Dell, HP, and Lenovo powered by NVIDIA DGX Spark
Winners receive hardware prizes and a speaking spot on the main stage
Attendance requires a valid GTC 2026 pass
analyst_angle: These structured, mission-driven hackathons signal NVIDIAâ€™s strategic push to operationalize its latest AI infrastructure (DGX Spark, Nemotron, Cosmos) through developer co-creation â€” accelerating real-world adoption beyond demos into production-grade tooling and impact-oriented solutions.

title: ğŸš€ Amazonâ€™s $50B OpenAI Investment Tied to IPO or AGI Milestone

sources.author: theinformation
sources.text: Exclusive: Amazonâ€™s potential $50B investment in OpenAI may hinge on two triggers: an IPO or reaching AGI. https://t.co/7UU4fTcA02

sources.author: theinformation
sources.text:
Amazonâ€™s investment in OpenAI comes with strict conditions, @srimuppidi reports:

"Amazon is investing up to $50 billion, but there is a condition."

"The $35B second installment is actually condition

sources.author: theinformation
sources.text:
Today on TITV:

-Amazonâ€™s $50 Billion investment in OpenAI could hinge on IPO, AGI | @srimuppidi

-Nvidia Results: Revenue Accelerates, Cash Flow Doubles | Matt Bryson, Equity Research at @Wedbush

-B

key_facts: Amazon is committing up to $50 billion to OpenAI
The $35 billion second tranche is explicitly conditional on either OpenAI achieving AGI or going public
The deal reflects unprecedented strategic alignmentâ€”and risk-sharingâ€”between a cloud infrastructure giant and the leading AGI-focused AI lab
analyst_angle: This conditional structure signals that hyperscalers now treat AGI not as speculative futurism but as a near-term, investable milestoneâ€”with valuation and capital deployment directly pegged to its realization.
